summary: This is a service request record from August 8, 2019, detailing a technical issue with a RAID system at 150 Park Row, New York, NY. It appears to be an internal IT or facilities maintenance ticket, with no direct mention of individuals or events related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned to work on the RAID system issue and instructed to start a case with Clognify.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Listed as assigned to the service request along with Jeff Cranor and Justin Houston.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Listed as assigned to the service request along with Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie.

persons.name: Hughwon
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who will get new drives from computer services for the RAID and replace them in the morning.

events.title: RAID system failure reported
events.description: A RAID system at 150 Park Row, New York, NY, is showing 2 'S's on the display, indicating a failure. A service request is created, and technicians are assigned to replace the drives.

keyFacts: The document is a service request ticket dated August 8, 2019, for a RAID system failure at 150 Park Row, New York, NY.
Technicians Jeff Cranor, Jeff McKenzie, and Justin Houston are assigned to address the issue.
A technician named Hughwon is tasked with obtaining new drives from computer services for replacement.
The request is marked as a priority requiring a call the same day.
The document appears to be routine IT/facilities maintenance with no evident connection to Epstein case activities or individuals.
